entry.title: Combined summary - BIP75 - Out of Band Address Exchange
entry.summary: A Bitcoin Improvement Proposal (BIP) titled "Out of Band Address Exchange using Payment Protocol Encryption" was proposed on March 1 and tentatively assigned number 75. This proposal includes optional fields to the BIP70 paymentDetails message, such as subtractable fee, fee per kb, and replace by fee. James MacWhyte sees this as a general modernization of BIP70, while Andreas Schildbach suggests that other extensions should go to separate BIPs. Justin Newton, Founder/CEO of Netki, Inc., is open to either leaving the extensions in or doing a separate BIP. In response to the fee part of BIP75, Schildbach suggests an absolute amount that the payee is willing to cover should be declared instead of letting the payee define a fee rate. There is debate on whether to include these extensions in the new BIP or create separate ones, with James MacWhyte arguing for their inclusion and Andreas Schildbach suggesting that other extensions should go to separate BIPs. The BIP process has a problem with referring to multiple orthogonal "sub-BIPs". However, there is no harm in using a BIP only for a small thing, and BIP numbers are infinite. Overall, the discussion on BIP75 continues on the bitcoin-dev mailing list, with no clear consensus on whether to keep the changes in the original BIP or to create a separate one. While some argue that these extensions are not specific to the features being proposed, others see them as an opportunity for a general modernization of BIP70. The BIP70 field extensions have been removed from this BIP for another time and a pull request to add the documentation to the main repo has been submitted. These extensions are seen as a general modernization of BIP70 and are not specific to the proposed features. There are concerns about polluting the original idea of BIP75 with unrelated extensions, but the team behind the proposal invites feedback and encourages people to take a look at the relevant section on Github.It is important to adhere to the process to maintain the integrity of the network. In general, the BIP process is used to propose changes to the Bitcoin protocol.
